```
PreToolUse:Read [~/.claude-code-docs/claude-docs-helper.sh hook-check] failed with non-blocking status code 127: 
/bin/sh: 1: /home/vscode/.claude-code-docs/claude-docs-helper.sh: not found
```

This error indicates that there's a hook configured that's trying to run a script at `/home/vscode/.claude-code-docs/claude-docs-helper.sh`, but this file doesn't exist in the devcontainer environment.

#!/bin/bash
set -euo pipefail

# Claude Code Documentation Helper Script v0.3.3
# This script handles all /docs command functionality  
# Installation path: ~/.claude-code-docs/claude-docs-helper.sh

# Script version
SCRIPT_VERSION="0.3.3"

# Fixed installation path (no need for placeholder replacement)
DOCS_PATH="$HOME/.claude-code-docs"
MANIFEST="$DOCS_PATH/docs/docs_manifest.json"

# No colors since they don't work in terminal anyway

# Enhanced sanitize function to prevent command injection
sanitize_input() {
    # Remove ALL shell metacharacters and control characters
    # Only allow alphanumeric, spaces, hyphens, underscores, periods, commas, apostrophes, and question marks
    echo "$1" | sed 's/[^a-zA-Z0-9 _.,'\''?-]//g' | sed 's/  */ /g' | sed 's/^ *//;s/ *$//'
}

# Function to print documentation header
print_doc_header() {
    echo "ðŸ“š COMMUNITY MIRROR: https://github.com/ericbuess/claude-code-docs"
    echo "ðŸ“– OFFICIAL DOCS: https://docs.anthropic.com/en/docs/claude-code"
    echo ""
}


# Function to auto-update docs if needed
auto_update() {
    cd "$DOCS_PATH" 2>/dev/null || return 1
    
    # Get current branch
    local BRANCH=$(git rev-parse --abbrev-ref HEAD 2>/dev/null || echo "main")
    
    # Quick fetch to check for updates (fast)
    if ! git fetch --quiet origin "$BRANCH" 2>/dev/null; then
        # Current branch doesn't exist on origin, try main
        if ! git fetch --quiet origin main 2>/dev/null; then
            # Fetch failed - can't sync
            return 2
        fi
        # Use main branch for comparison
        BRANCH="main"
    fi
    
    local LOCAL=$(git rev-parse HEAD 2>/dev/null)

content.thinking:
Perfect! Now I understand the issue. In the user's home `.claude/settings.json` (lines 61-73), there's a PreToolUse hook configured for the Read tool that tries to run `~/.claude-code-docs/claude-docs-helper.sh hook-check`. 

When the devcontainer is created, the `initializeCommand` (line 22 of devcontainer.json) copies the `~/.claude` directory to `.devcontainer/claude-config/`, so the hook configuration gets copied into the container. However, the `~/.claude-code-docs/` directory with the helper script is NOT copied to the container.

In the container, the home directory is `/home/vscode/`, so when the hook tries to run `~/.claude-code-docs/claude-docs-helper.sh`, it expands to `/home/vscode/.claude-code-docs/claude-docs-helper.sh`, which doesn't exist, causing the error.

Let me check the devcontainer setup script to see what's happening there.

#!/bin/bash
# Post-creation setup for Android development container

set -e

echo "ðŸš€ Setting up OSRS Wiki Android development environment..."

# Setup Android environment variables
export ANDROID_SDK_ROOT=/opt/android-sdk
export ANDROID_HOME=/opt/android-sdk
export PATH=$PATH:$ANDROID_SDK_ROOT/cmdline-tools/latest/bin:$ANDROID_SDK_ROOT/platform-tools

# Add to bashrc for persistence
echo "export ANDROID_SDK_ROOT=/opt/android-sdk" >> ~/.bashrc
echo "export ANDROID_HOME=/opt/android-sdk" >> ~/.bashrc
echo "export PATH=\$PATH:\$ANDROID_SDK_ROOT/cmdline-tools/latest/bin:\$ANDROID_SDK_ROOT/platform-tools" >> ~/.bashrc

# Add Claude Code alias for container use
echo "# Claude Code alias for safe container usage" >> ~/.bashrc
echo "alias c='claude --dangerously-skip-permissions'" >> ~/.bashrc

# Configure npm for global packages without sudo
echo "ðŸ“¦ Configuring npm..."
mkdir -p ~/.npm-global
npm config set prefix '~/.npm-global'
export PATH=~/.npm-global/bin:$PATH
echo 'export PATH=~/.npm-global/bin:$PATH' >> ~/.bashrc

# Install Claude Code CLI
echo "ðŸ“¦ Installing Claude Code CLI..."
npm install -g @anthropic-ai/claude-code@latest

# Copy Claude settings and configuration from host
echo "âš™ï¸  Setting up Claude configuration..."
if [ -d /workspace/.devcontainer/claude-config/.claude ]; then
    # Copy the entire .claude directory structure
    cp -r /workspace/.devcontainer/claude-config/.claude ~/.claude
    echo "âœ… Claude settings copied from host"
    
    # Show what we copied
    if [ -f ~/.claude/settings.json ]; then
        echo "   â€¢ Global settings migrated"
    fi
    if [ -f ~/.claude/settings.local.json ]; then
        echo "   â€¢ Local settings migrated" 
    fi
    if [ -d ~/.claude/commands ]; then
        echo "   â€¢ Custom commands migrated ($(ls ~/.claude/commands | wc -l) commands)"
    fi
    if [ -d ~/.claude/projects ]; then
        echo "   â€¢ Project history migrated"
    fi
    
else
    echo "âš ï¸  No Claude settings found on host"
fi

echo "ðŸ” Claude authentication:"
echo "   First time: run 'claude' and complete login flow"
echo "   After login: use 'c' alias for fast access"

# Make scripts executable
echo "ðŸ”§ Making scripts executable..."
find /workspace/scripts -name "*.sh" -exec chmod +x {} \; 2>/dev/null || true
chmod +x /workspace/main/gradlew 2>/dev/null || true

# Skip Android system images for simple test

# Create directory structure if needed
mkdir -p ~/.android
mkdir -p /tmp/android-tmp

# Test gradle wrapper
echo "ðŸ—ï¸  Testing Gradle wrapper..."
if [ -f "/workspace/main/gradlew" ]; then
    cd /workspace/main && ./gradlew --version
    echo "âœ… Gradle wrapper working"
else
    echo "âš ï¸  Gradle wrapper not found at /workspace/main/gradlew"
fi

echo ""
echo "ðŸŽ¯ Android development environment setup complete!"
echo "ðŸ“ Workspace: /workspace"
echo "ðŸ”§ Android SDK: $ANDROID_SDK_ROOT" 
echo "ðŸ› ï¸  Available commands: gradlew, adb, avdmanager, emulator"
echo ""
echo "ðŸ’¡ Quick start:"
echo "   claude       # First time: complete login"
echo "   c            # After login: fast Claude access"
echo "   /start       # Creates worktree session"
echo ""

input.plan:
## Issue Analysis
The error occurs because your host machine has a Claude Code hook configured that references `~/.claude-code-docs/claude-docs-helper.sh`, but this file doesn't exist in the devcontainer.

## Root Cause
1. Your host `~/.claude/settings.json` contains a PreToolUse hook for the Read tool
2. When the devcontainer initializes, it copies `~/.claude` but NOT `~/.claude-code-docs`
3. Inside the container, the hook tries to run `/home/vscode/.claude-code-docs/claude-docs-helper.sh` which doesn't exist

## Solution Options

### Option 1: Container-Specific Settings (Recommended)
Create separate Claude settings for the container that don't include host-specific hooks:
1. Create `.devcontainer/claude-settings.json` with container-appropriate settings
2. Modify `.devcontainer/setup.sh` to use container settings instead of copying host settings
3. Keep project-specific hooks (like auto-commit.sh) but remove host-specific ones

### Option 2: Copy Missing Dependencies
1. Modify `devcontainer.json` initializeCommand to also copy `~/.claude-code-docs`
2. Update `.devcontainer/setup.sh` to copy the docs helper directory
3. Ensure paths work correctly in container environment

### Option 3: Remove Problematic Hooks
1. Create a filtered version of settings during container setup
2. Strip out the PreToolUse hook for claude-docs-helper.sh
3. Keep other settings intact

## Implementation Steps (Option 1 - Recommended)
1. Create `.devcontainer/claude-settings.json` with clean container settings
2. Modify `.devcontainer/setup.sh` to use container-specific settings
3. Preserve project-specific hooks from `.claude/settings.json`
4. Test the container build to ensure no errors

#!/bin/bash
# Post-creation setup for Android development container

set -e

echo "ðŸš€ Setting up OSRS Wiki Android development environment..."

# Setup Android environment variables
export ANDROID_SDK_ROOT=/opt/android-sdk
export ANDROID_HOME=/opt/android-sdk
export PATH=$PATH:$ANDROID_SDK_ROOT/cmdline-tools/latest/bin:$ANDROID_SDK_ROOT/platform-tools

# Add to bashrc for persistence
echo "export ANDROID_SDK_ROOT=/opt/android-sdk" >> ~/.bashrc
echo "export ANDROID_HOME=/opt/android-sdk" >> ~/.bashrc
echo "export PATH=\$PATH:\$ANDROID_SDK_ROOT/cmdline-tools/latest/bin:\$ANDROID_SDK_ROOT/platform-tools" >> ~/.bashrc

# Add Claude Code alias for container use
echo "# Claude Code alias for safe container usage" >> ~/.bashrc
echo "alias c='claude --dangerously-skip-permissions'" >> ~/.bashrc

# Configure npm for global packages without sudo
echo "ðŸ“¦ Configuring npm..."
mkdir -p ~/.npm-global
npm config set prefix '~/.npm-global'
export PATH=~/.npm-global/bin:$PATH
echo 'export PATH=~/.npm-global/bin:$PATH' >> ~/.bashrc

# Install Claude Code CLI
echo "ðŸ“¦ Installing Claude Code CLI..."
npm install -g @anthropic-ai/claude-code@latest

# Copy Claude settings and configuration from host
echo "âš™ï¸  Setting up Claude configuration..."
if [ -d /workspace/.devcontainer/claude-config/.claude ]; then
    # Copy the entire .claude directory structure
    cp -r /workspace/.devcontainer/claude-config/.claude ~/.claude
    echo "âœ… Claude settings copied from host"
    
    # Show what we copied
    if [ -f ~/.claude/settings.json ]; then
        echo "   â€¢ Global settings migrated"
    fi
    if [ -f ~/.claude/settings.local.json ]; then
        echo "   â€¢ Local settings migrated" 
    fi
    if [ -d ~/.claude/commands ]; then
        echo "   â€¢ Custom commands migrated ($(ls ~/.claude/commands | wc -l) commands)"
    fi
    if [ -d ~/.claude/projects ]; then
        echo "   â€¢ Project history migrated"
    fi
    
else
    echo "âš ï¸  No Claude settings found on host"
fi

echo "ðŸ” Claude authentication:"
echo "   First time: run 'claude' and complete login flow"
echo "   After login: use 'c' alias for fast access"

# Make scripts executable
echo "ðŸ”§ Making scripts executable..."
find /workspace/scripts -name "*.sh" -exec chmod +x {} \; 2>/dev/null || true
chmod +x /workspace/main/gradlew 2>/dev/null || true

# Skip Android system images for simple test

# Create directory structure if needed
mkdir -p ~/.android
mkdir -p /tmp/android-tmp

# Test gradle wrapper
echo "ðŸ—ï¸  Testing Gradle wrapper..."
if [ -f "/workspace/main/gradlew" ]; then
    cd /workspace/main && ./gradlew --version
    echo "âœ… Gradle wrapper working"
else
    echo "âš ï¸  Gradle wrapper not found at /workspace/main/gradlew"
fi

echo ""
echo "ðŸŽ¯ Android development environment setup complete!"
echo "ðŸ“ Workspace: /workspace"
echo "ðŸ”§ Android SDK: $ANDROID_SDK_ROOT" 
echo "ðŸ› ï¸  Available commands: gradlew, adb, avdmanager, emulator"
echo ""
echo "ðŸ’¡ Quick start:"
echo "   claude       # First time: complete login"
echo "   c            # After login: fast Claude access"
echo "   /start       # Creates worktree session"
echo ""
